40#ifndef _NETINET_SCTP_CONSTANTS_H_
41#define _NETINET_SCTP_CONSTANTS_H_
42
43#if defined(_WIN32) && defined(__Userspace__)
44extern void getwintimeofday(struct timeval *tv);
45
46#endif
47/* IANA assigned port number for SCTP over UDP encapsulation */
48#define SCTP_OVER_UDP_TUNNELING_PORT 9899
49
50/* Number of packets to get before sack sent by default */
51#define SCTP_DEFAULT_SACK_FREQ 2
52
53/* Address limit - This variable is calculated
54 * based on an 65535 byte max ip packet. We take out 100 bytes
55 * for the cookie, 40 bytes for a v6 header and 32
56 * bytes for the init structure. A second init structure
57 * for the init-ack and then finally a third one for the
58 * imbedded init. This yeilds 100+40+(3 * 32) = 236 bytes.
59 * This leaves 65299 bytes for addresses. We throw out the 299 bytes.
60 * Now whatever we send in the INIT() we need to allow to get back in the
61 * INIT-ACK plus all the values from INIT and INIT-ACK
62 * listed in the cookie. Plus we need some overhead for
63 * maybe copied parameters in the COOKIE. If we
64 * allow 1080 addresses, and each side has 1080 V6 addresses
65 * that will be 21600 bytes. In the INIT-ACK we will
66 * see the INIT-ACK 21600 + 43200 in the cookie. This leaves
67 * about 500 bytes slack for misc things in the cookie.
68 */
69#define SCTP_ADDRESS_LIMIT 1080
70
71/* We need at least 2k of space for us, inits
72 * larger than that lets abort.
73 */
74#define SCTP_LARGEST_INIT_ACCEPTED (65535 - 2048)
75
76/* Largest length of a chunk */
77#define SCTP_MAX_CHUNK_LENGTH 0xffff
78/* Largest length of an error cause */
79#define SCTP_MAX_CAUSE_LENGTH 0xffff
80/* Number of addresses where we just skip the counting */
81#define SCTP_COUNT_LIMIT 40
82
83#define SCTP_ZERO_COPY_TICK_DELAY (((100 * hz) + 999) / 1000)
84#define SCTP_ZERO_COPY_SENDQ_TICK_DELAY (((100 * hz) + 999) / 1000)
85
86/* Number of ticks to delay before running
87 * iterator on an address change.
88 */
89#define SCTP_ADDRESS_TICK_DELAY 2
90
91#define SCTP_VERSION_STRING "KAME-BSD 1.1"
92/* #define SCTP_AUDITING_ENABLED 1 used for debug/auditing */
93#define SCTP_AUDIT_SIZE 256
94
95#define SCTP_KTRHEAD_NAME "sctp_iterator"
96#define SCTP_KTHREAD_PAGES 0
97
98#define SCTP_MCORE_NAME "sctp_core_worker"
99
100/* If you support Multi-VRF how big to
101 * make the initial array of VRF's to.
102 */
103#define SCTP_DEFAULT_VRF_SIZE 4
104
105/* JRS - Values defined for the HTCP algorithm */
106#define ALPHA_BASE (1<<7) /* 1.0 with shift << 7 */
107#define BETA_MIN (1<<6) /* 0.5 with shift << 7 */
108#define BETA_MAX 102 /* 0.8 with shift << 7 */
109

234/*
235 * To turn on various logging, you must first enable 'options KTR' and
236 * you might want to bump the entires 'options KTR_ENTRIES=80000'.
237 * To get something to log you define one of the logging defines.
238 * (see LINT).
239 *
240 * This gets the compile in place, but you still need to turn the
241 * logging flag on too in the sysctl (see in sctp.h).
242 */
243
244#define SCTP_LOG_EVENT_UNKNOWN 0
245#define SCTP_LOG_EVENT_CWND 1
246#define SCTP_LOG_EVENT_BLOCK 2
247#define SCTP_LOG_EVENT_STRM 3
248#define SCTP_LOG_EVENT_FR 4
249#define SCTP_LOG_EVENT_MAP 5
250#define SCTP_LOG_EVENT_MAXBURST 6
251#define SCTP_LOG_EVENT_RWND 7
252#define SCTP_LOG_EVENT_MBCNT 8
253#define SCTP_LOG_EVENT_SACK 9
254#define SCTP_LOG_LOCK_EVENT 10
255#define SCTP_LOG_EVENT_RTT 11
256#define SCTP_LOG_EVENT_SB 12
257#define SCTP_LOG_EVENT_NAGLE 13
258#define SCTP_LOG_EVENT_WAKE 14
259#define SCTP_LOG_MISC_EVENT 15
260#define SCTP_LOG_EVENT_CLOSE 16
261#define SCTP_LOG_EVENT_MBUF 17
262#define SCTP_LOG_CHUNK_PROC 18
263#define SCTP_LOG_ERROR_RET 19
264
265#define SCTP_LOG_MAX_EVENT 20
266
267#define SCTP_LOCK_UNKNOWN 2
268
269/* number of associations by default for zone allocation */
270#define SCTP_MAX_NUM_OF_ASOC 40000
271/* how many addresses per assoc remote and local */
272#define SCTP_SCALE_FOR_ADDR 2
273
274/* default MULTIPLE_ASCONF mode enable(1)/disable(0) value (sysctl) */
275#define SCTP_DEFAULT_MULTIPLE_ASCONFS 0
276
277/*
278 * Threshold for rwnd updates, we have to read (sb_hiwat >>
279 * SCTP_RWND_HIWAT_SHIFT) before we will look to see if we need to send a
280 * window update sack. When we look, we compare the last rwnd we sent vs the
281 * current rwnd. It too must be greater than this value. Using 3 divdes the
282 * hiwat by 8, so for 200k rwnd we need to read 24k. For a 64k rwnd we need
283 * to read 8k. This seems about right.. I hope :-D.. we do set a
284 * min of a MTU on it so if the rwnd is real small we will insist
285 * on a full MTU of 1500 bytes.
286 */
287#define SCTP_RWND_HIWAT_SHIFT 3
288
289/* How much of the rwnd must the
290 * message be taking up to start partial delivery.
291 * We calculate this by shifing the hi_water (recv_win)
292 * left the following .. set to 1, when a message holds
293 * 1/2 the rwnd. If we set it to 2 when a message holds
294 * 1/4 the rwnd...etc..
295 */
296
297#define SCTP_PARTIAL_DELIVERY_SHIFT 1
298
299/*
300 * default HMAC for cookies, etc... use one of the AUTH HMAC id's
301 * SCTP_HMAC is the HMAC_ID to use
302 * SCTP_SIGNATURE_SIZE is the digest length
303 */
304#define SCTP_HMAC SCTP_AUTH_HMAC_ID_SHA1
305#define SCTP_SIGNATURE_SIZE SCTP_AUTH_DIGEST_LEN_SHA1
306#define SCTP_SIGNATURE_ALOC_SIZE SCTP_SIGNATURE_SIZE
307
308/*
309 * the SCTP protocol signature this includes the version number encoded in
310 * the last 4 bits of the signature.
311 */
312#define PROTO_SIGNATURE_A 0x30000000
313#define SCTP_VERSION_NUMBER 0x3
314
315#define MAX_TSN 0xffffffff
316
317/* how many executions every N tick's */
318#define SCTP_ITERATOR_MAX_AT_ONCE 20
319
320/* number of clock ticks between iterator executions */
321#define SCTP_ITERATOR_TICKS 1
322
323/*
324 * option: If you comment out the following you will receive the old behavior
325 * of obeying cwnd for the fast retransmit algorithm. With this defined a FR
326 * happens right away with-out waiting for the flightsize to drop below the
327 * cwnd value (which is reduced by the FR to 1/2 the inflight packets).
328 */
329#define SCTP_IGNORE_CWND_ON_FR 1
330
331/*
332 * Adds implementors guide behavior to only use newest highest update in SACK
333 * gap ack's to figure out if you need to stroke a chunk for FR.
334 */
335#define SCTP_NO_FR_UNLESS_SEGMENT_SMALLER 1
336
337/* default max I can burst out after a fast retransmit, 0 disables it */
338#define SCTP_DEF_MAX_BURST 4
339#define SCTP_DEF_HBMAX_BURST 4
340#define SCTP_DEF_FRMAX_BURST 4
341
342/* RTO calculation flag to say if it
343 * is safe to determine local lan or not.
344 */
345#define SCTP_RTT_FROM_NON_DATA 0
346#define SCTP_RTT_FROM_DATA 1
347
348#define PR_SCTP_UNORDERED_FLAG 0x0001
349
350/* IP hdr (20/40) + 12+2+2 (enet) + sctp common 12 */
351#define SCTP_FIRST_MBUF_RESV 68
352/* Packet transmit states in the sent field */
353#define SCTP_DATAGRAM_UNSENT 0
354#define SCTP_DATAGRAM_SENT 1
355#define SCTP_DATAGRAM_RESEND1 2 /* not used (in code, but may
356 * hit this value) */
357#define SCTP_DATAGRAM_RESEND2 3 /* not used (in code, but may
358 * hit this value) */
359#define SCTP_DATAGRAM_RESEND 4
360#define SCTP_DATAGRAM_ACKED 10010
361#define SCTP_DATAGRAM_MARKED 20010
362#define SCTP_FORWARD_TSN_SKIP 30010
363#define SCTP_DATAGRAM_NR_ACKED 40010
364
365/* chunk output send from locations */
366#define SCTP_OUTPUT_FROM_USR_SEND 0
367#define SCTP_OUTPUT_FROM_T3 1
368#define SCTP_OUTPUT_FROM_INPUT_ERROR 2
369#define SCTP_OUTPUT_FROM_CONTROL_PROC 3
370#define SCTP_OUTPUT_FROM_SACK_TMR 4
371#define SCTP_OUTPUT_FROM_SHUT_TMR 5
372#define SCTP_OUTPUT_FROM_HB_TMR 6
373#define SCTP_OUTPUT_FROM_SHUT_ACK_TMR 7
374#define SCTP_OUTPUT_FROM_ASCONF_TMR 8
375#define SCTP_OUTPUT_FROM_STRRST_TMR 9
376#define SCTP_OUTPUT_FROM_AUTOCLOSE_TMR 10
377#define SCTP_OUTPUT_FROM_EARLY_FR_TMR 11
378#define SCTP_OUTPUT_FROM_STRRST_REQ 12
379#define SCTP_OUTPUT_FROM_USR_RCVD 13
380#define SCTP_OUTPUT_FROM_COOKIE_ACK 14
381#define SCTP_OUTPUT_FROM_DRAIN 15
382#define SCTP_OUTPUT_FROM_CLOSING 16
383#define SCTP_OUTPUT_FROM_SOCKOPT 17
384
385/* SCTP chunk types are moved sctp.h for application (NAT, FW) use */
386
387/* align to 32-bit sizes */
388#define SCTP_SIZE32(x) ((((x) + 3) >> 2) << 2)
389
390#define IS_SCTP_CONTROL(a) (((a)->chunk_type != SCTP_DATA) && ((a)->chunk_type != SCTP_IDATA))
391#define IS_SCTP_DATA(a) (((a)->chunk_type == SCTP_DATA) || ((a)->chunk_type == SCTP_IDATA))
392
393/* SCTP parameter types */
394/*************0x0000 series*************/
395#define SCTP_HEARTBEAT_INFO 0x0001
396#if defined(__Userspace__)
397#define SCTP_CONN_ADDRESS 0x0004
398#endif
399#define SCTP_IPV4_ADDRESS 0x0005
400#define SCTP_IPV6_ADDRESS 0x0006
401#define SCTP_STATE_COOKIE 0x0007
402#define SCTP_UNRECOG_PARAM 0x0008
403#define SCTP_COOKIE_PRESERVE 0x0009
404#define SCTP_HOSTNAME_ADDRESS 0x000b
405#define SCTP_SUPPORTED_ADDRTYPE 0x000c
406
407/* RFC 6525 */
408#define SCTP_STR_RESET_OUT_REQUEST 0x000d
409#define SCTP_STR_RESET_IN_REQUEST 0x000e
410#define SCTP_STR_RESET_TSN_REQUEST 0x000f
411#define SCTP_STR_RESET_RESPONSE 0x0010
412#define SCTP_STR_RESET_ADD_OUT_STREAMS 0x0011
413#define SCTP_STR_RESET_ADD_IN_STREAMS 0x0012
414
415#define SCTP_MAX_RESET_PARAMS 2
416#define SCTP_STREAM_RESET_TSN_DELTA 0x1000
417
418/*************0x4000 series*************/
419
420/*************0x8000 series*************/
421#define SCTP_ECN_CAPABLE 0x8000
422
423/* RFC 4895 */
424#define SCTP_RANDOM 0x8002
425#define SCTP_CHUNK_LIST 0x8003
426#define SCTP_HMAC_LIST 0x8004
427/* RFC 4820 */
428#define SCTP_PAD 0x8005
429/* RFC 5061 */
430#define SCTP_SUPPORTED_CHUNK_EXT 0x8008
431
432/*************0xC000 series*************/
433#define SCTP_PRSCTP_SUPPORTED 0xc000
434/* RFC 5061 */
435#define SCTP_ADD_IP_ADDRESS 0xc001
436#define SCTP_DEL_IP_ADDRESS 0xc002
437#define SCTP_ERROR_CAUSE_IND 0xc003
438#define SCTP_SET_PRIM_ADDR 0xc004
439#define SCTP_SUCCESS_REPORT 0xc005
440#define SCTP_ULP_ADAPTATION 0xc006
441/* behave-nat-draft */
442#define SCTP_HAS_NAT_SUPPORT 0xc007
443#define SCTP_NAT_VTAGS 0xc008
444
445/* bits for TOS field */
446#define SCTP_ECT0_BIT 0x02
447#define SCTP_ECT1_BIT 0x01
448#define SCTP_CE_BITS 0x03
449
450/* below turns off above */
451#define SCTP_FLEXIBLE_ADDRESS 0x20
452#define SCTP_NO_HEARTBEAT 0x40
453
454/* mask to get sticky */
455#define SCTP_STICKY_OPTIONS_MASK 0x0c
456
457/*
458 * SCTP states for internal state machine
459 */
460#define SCTP_STATE_EMPTY 0x0000
461#define SCTP_STATE_INUSE 0x0001
462#define SCTP_STATE_COOKIE_WAIT 0x0002
463#define SCTP_STATE_COOKIE_ECHOED 0x0004
464#define SCTP_STATE_OPEN 0x0008
465#define SCTP_STATE_SHUTDOWN_SENT 0x0010
466#define SCTP_STATE_SHUTDOWN_RECEIVED 0x0020
467#define SCTP_STATE_SHUTDOWN_ACK_SENT 0x0040
468#define SCTP_STATE_SHUTDOWN_PENDING 0x0080
469#define SCTP_STATE_CLOSED_SOCKET 0x0100
470#define SCTP_STATE_ABOUT_TO_BE_FREED 0x0200
471#define SCTP_STATE_PARTIAL_MSG_LEFT 0x0400
472#define SCTP_STATE_WAS_ABORTED 0x0800
473#define SCTP_STATE_IN_ACCEPT_QUEUE 0x1000
474#define SCTP_STATE_MASK 0x007f
475
476#define SCTP_GET_STATE(_stcb) \
477 ((_stcb)->asoc.state & SCTP_STATE_MASK)
478#define SCTP_SET_STATE(_stcb, _state) \
479 sctp_set_state(_stcb, _state)
480#define SCTP_CLEAR_SUBSTATE(_stcb, _substate) \
481 (_stcb)->asoc.state &= ~(_substate)
482#define SCTP_ADD_SUBSTATE(_stcb, _substate) \
483 sctp_add_substate(_stcb, _substate)
484
485/* SCTP reachability state for each address */
486#define SCTP_ADDR_REACHABLE 0x001
487#define SCTP_ADDR_NO_PMTUD 0x002
488#define SCTP_ADDR_NOHB 0x004
489#define SCTP_ADDR_BEING_DELETED 0x008
490#define SCTP_ADDR_NOT_IN_ASSOC 0x010
491#define SCTP_ADDR_OUT_OF_SCOPE 0x080
492#define SCTP_ADDR_UNCONFIRMED 0x200
493#define SCTP_ADDR_REQ_PRIMARY 0x400
494/* JRS 5/13/07 - Added potentially failed state for CMT PF */
495#define SCTP_ADDR_PF 0x800
496
497/* bound address types (e.g. valid address types to allow) */
498#define SCTP_BOUND_V6 0x01
499#define SCTP_BOUND_V4 0x02
500
501/*
502 * what is the default number of mbufs in a chain I allow before switching to
503 * a cluster
504 */
505#define SCTP_DEFAULT_MBUFS_IN_CHAIN 5
506
507/* How long a cookie lives in milli-seconds */
508#define SCTP_DEFAULT_COOKIE_LIFE 60000
509
510/* Maximum the mapping array will grow to (TSN mapping array) */
511#define SCTP_MAPPING_ARRAY 512
512
513/* size of the initial malloc on the mapping array */
514#define SCTP_INITIAL_MAPPING_ARRAY 16
515/* how much we grow the mapping array each call */
516#define SCTP_MAPPING_ARRAY_INCR 32
517
518/*
519 * Here we define the timer types used by the implementation as arguments in
520 * the set/get timer type calls.
521 */
522#define SCTP_TIMER_INIT 0
523#define SCTP_TIMER_RECV 1
524#define SCTP_TIMER_SEND 2
525#define SCTP_TIMER_HEARTBEAT 3
526#define SCTP_TIMER_PMTU 4
527#define SCTP_TIMER_MAXSHUTDOWN 5
528#define SCTP_TIMER_SIGNATURE 6
529/*
530 * number of timer types in the base SCTP structure used in the set/get and
531 * has the base default.
532 */
533#define SCTP_NUM_TMRS 7
534
535/* timer types */
536#define SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_NONE 0
537#define SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_SEND 1
538#define SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_INIT 2
539#define SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_RECV 3
540#define SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_SHUTDOWN 4
541#define SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_HEARTBEAT 5
542#define SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_COOKIE 6
543#define SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_NEWCOOKIE 7
544#define SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_PATHMTURAISE 8
545#define SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_SHUTDOWNACK 9
546#define SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_ASCONF 10
547#define SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_SHUTDOWNGUARD 11
548#define SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_AUTOCLOSE 12
549#define SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_STRRESET 13
550#define SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_INPKILL 14
551#define SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_ASOCKILL 15
552#define SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_ADDR_WQ 16
553#define SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_PRIM_DELETED 17
554/* add new timers here - and increment LAST */
555#define SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_LAST 18
556
557#define SCTP_IS_TIMER_TYPE_VALID(t) (((t) > SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_NONE) && \
558 ((t) < SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_LAST))
559
560#if defined(__APPLE__) && !defined(__Userspace__)
561/* Number of ticks to run the main timer at in msec */
562#define SCTP_MAIN_TIMER_DEFAULT 10
563
564#endif
565/* max number of TSN's dup'd that I will hold */
566#define SCTP_MAX_DUP_TSNS 20
567
568/*
569 * Here we define the types used when setting the retry amounts.
570 */
571/* How many drop re-attempts we make on INIT/COOKIE-ECHO */
572#define SCTP_RETRY_DROPPED_THRESH 4
573
574/*
575 * Maxmium number of chunks a single association can have on it. Note that
576 * this is a squishy number since the count can run over this if the user
577 * sends a large message down .. the fragmented chunks don't count until
578 * AFTER the message is on queue.. it would be the next send that blocks
579 * things. This number will get tuned up at boot in the sctp_init and use the
580 * number of clusters as a base. This way high bandwidth environments will
581 * not get impacted by the lower bandwidth sending a bunch of 1 byte chunks
582 */
583#define SCTP_ASOC_MAX_CHUNKS_ON_QUEUE 512
584
585/*
586 * Basically the minimum amount of time before I do a early FR. Making this
587 * value to low will cause duplicate retransmissions.
588 */
589#define SCTP_MINFR_MSEC_TIMER 250
590/* The floor this value is allowed to fall to when starting a timer. */
591#define SCTP_MINFR_MSEC_FLOOR 20
592
593/* init timer def = 1 sec */
594#define SCTP_INIT_SEC 1
595
596/* send timer def = 1 seconds */
597#define SCTP_SEND_SEC 1
598
599/* recv timer def = 200ms */
600#define SCTP_RECV_MSEC 200
601
602/* 30 seconds + RTO (in ms) */
603#define SCTP_HB_DEFAULT_MSEC 30000
604
605/*
606 * This is how long a secret lives, NOT how long a cookie lives how many
607 * ticks the current secret will live.
608 */
609#define SCTP_DEFAULT_SECRET_LIFE_SEC 3600
610
611#define SCTP_RTO_UPPER_BOUND (60000) /* 60 sec in ms */
612#define SCTP_RTO_LOWER_BOUND (1000) /* 1 sec is ms */
613#define SCTP_RTO_INITIAL (1000) /* 1 sec in ms */
614
615#define SCTP_INP_KILL_TIMEOUT 20 /* number of ms to retry kill of inpcb */
616#define SCTP_ASOC_KILL_TIMEOUT 10 /* number of ms to retry kill of inpcb */
617
618#define SCTP_DEF_MAX_INIT 8
619#define SCTP_DEF_MAX_SEND 10
620#define SCTP_DEF_MAX_PATH_RTX 5
621#define SCTP_DEF_PATH_PF_THRESHOLD SCTP_DEF_MAX_PATH_RTX
622
623#define SCTP_DEF_PMTU_RAISE_SEC 600 /* 10 min between raise attempts */
624
625/* How many streams I request initially by default */
626#define SCTP_OSTREAM_INITIAL 10
627#define SCTP_ISTREAM_INITIAL 2048
628
629/*
630 * How many smallest_mtu's need to increase before a window update sack is
631 * sent (should be a power of 2).
632 */
633/* Send window update (incr * this > hiwat). Should be a power of 2 */
634#define SCTP_MINIMAL_RWND (4096) /* minimal rwnd */
635
636#define SCTP_ADDRMAX 16

678/* What sender needs to see to avoid SWS or we consider peers rwnd 0 */
679#define SCTP_SWS_SENDER_DEF 1420

681/*
682 * SWS is scaled to the sb_hiwat of the socket. A value of 2 is hiwat/4, 1
683 * would be hiwat/2 etc.
684 */
685/* What receiver needs to see in sockbuf or we tell peer its 1 */
686#define SCTP_SWS_RECEIVER_DEF 3000

829/* This value determines the default for when
830 * we try to add more on the send queue., if
831 * there is room. This prevents us from cycling
832 * into the copy_resume routine to often if
833 * we have not got enough space to add a decent
834 * enough size message. Note that if we have enough
835 * space to complete the message copy we will always
836 * add to the message, no matter what the size. Its
837 * only when we reach the point that we have some left
838 * to add, there is only room for part of it that we
839 * will use this threshold. Its also a sysctl.
840 */
841#define SCTP_DEFAULT_ADD_MORE 1452

845#define SCTP_PCBHASHSIZE 256
846#endif

849#endif

852#define SCTP_CHUNKQUEUE_SCALE 10
853#endif

855#if defined(__FreeBSD__) && !defined(__Userspace__)
856/* clock variance is 1 ms */
857#define SCTP_CLOCK_GRANULARITY 1
858#else
859/* clock variance is 10 ms */
860#define SCTP_CLOCK_GRANULARITY 10
861#endif
862#define IP_HDR_SIZE 40 /* we use the size of a IP6 header here this
863 * detracts a small amount for ipv4 but it
864 * simplifies the ipv6 addition */

866/* Argument magic number for sctp_inpcb_free() */
867
868/* third argument */
869#define SCTP_CALLED_DIRECTLY_NOCMPSET 0
870#define SCTP_CALLED_AFTER_CMPSET_OFCLOSE 1
871#define SCTP_CALLED_FROM_INPKILL_TIMER 2
872/* second argument */
873#define SCTP_FREE_SHOULD_USE_ABORT 1
874#define SCTP_FREE_SHOULD_USE_GRACEFUL_CLOSE 0

876#ifndef IPPROTO_SCTP
877#define IPPROTO_SCTP 132 /* the Official IANA number :-) */
878#endif /* !IPPROTO_SCTP */
879
880#define SCTP_MAX_DATA_BUNDLING 256
881
882/* modular comparison */
883/* See RFC 1982 for details. */
884#define SCTP_UINT16_GT(a, b) (((a < b) && ((uint16_t)(b - a) > (1U<<15))) || \
885 ((a > b) && ((uint16_t)(a - b) < (1U<<15))))
886#define SCTP_UINT16_GE(a, b) (SCTP_UINT16_GT(a, b) || (a == b))
887#define SCTP_UINT32_GT(a, b) (((a < b) && ((uint32_t)(b - a) > (1U<<31))) || \
888 ((a > b) && ((uint32_t)(a - b) < (1U<<31))))
889#define SCTP_UINT32_GE(a, b) (SCTP_UINT32_GT(a, b) || (a == b))
890
891#define SCTP_SSN_GT(a, b) SCTP_UINT16_GT(a, b)
892#define SCTP_SSN_GE(a, b) SCTP_UINT16_GE(a, b)
893#define SCTP_TSN_GT(a, b) SCTP_UINT32_GT(a, b)
894#define SCTP_TSN_GE(a, b) SCTP_UINT32_GE(a, b)
895#define SCTP_MID_GT(i, a, b) (((i) == 1) ? SCTP_UINT32_GT(a, b) : SCTP_UINT16_GT((uint16_t)a, (uint16_t)b))
896#define SCTP_MID_GE(i, a, b) (((i) == 1) ? SCTP_UINT32_GE(a, b) : SCTP_UINT16_GE((uint16_t)a, (uint16_t)b))
897#define SCTP_MID_EQ(i, a, b) (((i) == 1) ? a == b : (uint16_t)a == (uint16_t)b)
898
899/* Mapping array manipulation routines */
900#define SCTP_IS_TSN_PRESENT(arry, gap) ((arry[(gap >> 3)] >> (gap & 0x07)) & 0x01)
901#define SCTP_SET_TSN_PRESENT(arry, gap) (arry[(gap >> 3)] |= (0x01 << ((gap & 0x07))))
902#define SCTP_UNSET_TSN_PRESENT(arry, gap) (arry[(gap >> 3)] &= ((~(0x01 << ((gap & 0x07)))) & 0xff))
903#define SCTP_CALC_TSN_TO_GAP(gap, tsn, mapping_tsn) do { \
904 if (tsn >= mapping_tsn) { \
905 gap = tsn - mapping_tsn; \
906 } else { \
907 gap = (MAX_TSN - mapping_tsn) + tsn + 1; \
908 } \
909 } while (0)
910
911#define SCTP_RETRAN_DONE -1
912#define SCTP_RETRAN_EXIT -2
913
914/*
915 * This value defines the number of vtag block time wait entry's per list
916 * element. Each entry will take 2 4 byte ints (and of course the overhead
917 * of the next pointer as well). Using 15 as an example will yield * ((8 *
918 * 15) + 8) or 128 bytes of overhead for each timewait block that gets
919 * initialized. Increasing it to 31 would yield 256 bytes per block.
920 */
921#define SCTP_NUMBER_IN_VTAG_BLOCK 15
922/*
923 * If we use the STACK option, we have an array of this size head pointers.
924 * This array is mod'd the with the size to find which bucket and then all
925 * entries must be searched to see if the tag is in timed wait. If so we
926 * reject it.
927 */
928#define SCTP_STACK_VTAG_HASH_SIZE 32
929
930/*
931 * Number of seconds of time wait for a vtag.
932 */
933#define SCTP_TIME_WAIT 60
934
935/* How many micro seconds is the cutoff from
936 * local lan type rtt's
937 */
938 /*
939 * We allow 900us for the rtt.
940 */
941#define SCTP_LOCAL_LAN_RTT 900
942#define SCTP_LAN_UNKNOWN 0
943#define SCTP_LAN_LOCAL 1
944#define SCTP_LAN_INTERNET 2
945
946#define SCTP_SEND_BUFFER_SPLITTING 0x00000001
947#define SCTP_RECV_BUFFER_SPLITTING 0x00000002
948
949/* The system retains a cache of free chunks such to
950 * cut down on calls the memory allocation system. There
951 * is a per association limit of free items and a overall
952 * system limit. If either one gets hit then the resource
953 * stops being cached.
954 */
955
956#define SCTP_DEF_ASOC_RESC_LIMIT 10
957#define SCTP_DEF_SYSTEM_RESC_LIMIT 1000
958
959/*-
960 * defines for socket lock states.
961 * Used by __APPLE__
962 */
963#define SCTP_SO_LOCKED 1
964#define SCTP_SO_NOT_LOCKED 0
965
966/*-
967 * For address locks, do we hold the lock?
968 */
969#define SCTP_ADDR_LOCKED 1
970#define SCTP_ADDR_NOT_LOCKED 0
971
972#define IN4_ISPRIVATE_ADDRESS(a) \
973 ((((uint8_t *)&(a)->s_addr)[0] == 10) || \
974 ((((uint8_t *)&(a)->s_addr)[0] == 172) && \
975 (((uint8_t *)&(a)->s_addr)[1] >= 16) && \
976 (((uint8_t *)&(a)->s_addr)[1] <= 32)) || \
977 ((((uint8_t *)&(a)->s_addr)[0] == 192) && \
978 (((uint8_t *)&(a)->s_addr)[1] == 168)))
979
980#define IN4_ISLOOPBACK_ADDRESS(a) \
981 (((uint8_t *)&(a)->s_addr)[0] == 127)
982
983#define IN4_ISLINKLOCAL_ADDRESS(a) \
984 ((((uint8_t *)&(a)->s_addr)[0] == 169) && \
985 (((uint8_t *)&(a)->s_addr)[1] == 254))
986

988#define SCTP_SOCKET_OPTION_LIMIT (64 * 1024)

990#if defined(__Userspace__)
991#if defined(_WIN32)
992#define SCTP_GETTIME_TIMEVAL(x) getwintimeofday(x)
993#define SCTP_GETPTIME_TIMEVAL(x) getwintimeofday(x) /* this doesn't seem to ever be used.. */
994#else
995#define SCTP_GETTIME_TIMEVAL(x) gettimeofday(x, NULL)
996#define SCTP_GETPTIME_TIMEVAL(x) gettimeofday(x, NULL)
997#endif
998#endif

1004#if defined(_KERNEL) || defined(__Userspace__)
1005#define sctp_sowwakeup(inp, so) \
1006do { \
1007 if (inp->sctp_flags & SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_DONT_WAKE) { \
1008 inp->sctp_flags |= SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_WAKEOUTPUT; \
1009 } else { \
1010 sowwakeup(so); \
1011 } \
1012} while (0)
1013
1014#if defined(__FreeBSD__) || defined(_WIN32) || defined(__Userspace__)
1015#define sctp_sowwakeup_locked(inp, so) \
1016do { \
1017 if (inp->sctp_flags & SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_DONT_WAKE) { \
1018 SOCKBUF_UNLOCK(&((so)->so_snd)); \
1019 inp->sctp_flags |= SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_WAKEOUTPUT; \
1020 } else { \
1021 sowwakeup_locked(so); \
1022 } \
1023} while (0)
1024#else
1025#define sctp_sowwakeup_locked(inp, so) \
1026do { \
1027 if (inp->sctp_flags & SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_DONT_WAKE) { \
1028 SOCKBUF_UNLOCK(&((so)->so_snd)); \
1029 inp->sctp_flags |= SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_WAKEOUTPUT; \
1030 } else { \
1031 sowwakeup(so); \
1032 } \
1033} while (0)
1034#endif
1035
1036#define sctp_sorwakeup(inp, so) \
1037do { \
1038 if (inp->sctp_flags & SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_DONT_WAKE) { \
1039 inp->sctp_flags |= SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_WAKEINPUT; \
1040 } else { \
1041 sorwakeup(so); \
1042 } \
1043} while (0)
1044
1045#if defined(__FreeBSD__) || defined(_WIN32) || defined(__Userspace__)
1046#define sctp_sorwakeup_locked(inp, so) \
1047do { \
1048 if (inp->sctp_flags & SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_DONT_WAKE) { \
1049 inp->sctp_flags |= SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_WAKEINPUT; \
1050 SOCKBUF_UNLOCK(&((so)->so_rcv)); \
1051 } else { \
1052 sorwakeup_locked(so); \
1053 } \
1054} while (0)
1055#else
1056
1057#define sctp_sorwakeup_locked(inp, so) \
1058do { \
1059 if (inp->sctp_flags & SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_DONT_WAKE) { \
1060 inp->sctp_flags |= SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_WAKEINPUT; \
1061 SOCKBUF_UNLOCK(&((so)->so_rcv)); \
1062 } else { \
1063 sorwakeup(so); \
1064 } \
1065} while (0)
1066#endif
1067
1068#endif /* _KERNEL || __Userspace__*/
1069#endif
